pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: kitului anga, semaumaqan a sinsi, qivu a pancang a mayatucu, “gacalji! kicungali!”
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pasiqacamen a qivu, “navenala sun sinsi.”
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu kitulutulu amen, tuluan amen ni sinsi tua supu na kinacalisiyanan.
In class, the teacher taught us the paiwan language of numbers.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: kitjavililj amen a kitulu tjai sinsi, saka men a semenasenay anga tua senay nua semupu.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: liyav anga ku kinacaqu a penaiwanan a kai.
I have learned many paiwan languages.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我學會好多族語。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: djemedje aken a sema gakku, djemedje aken a kitulu tua pinaiwanan, uri ku sipaladenga tjai kina.
I go to school every day, I learn the paiwan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ti Ljumeg a ku ngadan.
My name is Ljumeg.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我的名字是Ljumeg。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ti Kuljelje a ngadan na ku kama.
My dad’s name is Kuljelje.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我爸爸的名字是Kuljelje。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ti Sauniyaw a ngadan na ku kina.
My mother’s name is Sauniyaw.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我媽媽的名字是Sauniyaw。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tapuluq anga a ku cavilj tucu.
I am 10 years old.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我今年10歲。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua za ku kaka a uqaljay a tjavulung, ti Kapi a ngadan, tapuluq anga saka ita a cavilj nimadju.
I have a brother, his name is Kapi, he is 11 years old.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Kapi，他今年11歲。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: i tagakkuan amen a kitulutulu.
We study in the same school.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tjengelay amen aravac a semenay.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們都很喜歡唱歌。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tjengelay aken a emave’av/ljemanguy, nu kaljapulavayan, vaik amen a emave’av/ljemanguy a tacekeljan.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tjengelay aken a kipuqali(kipudrava), maqati amen a maciyuciyur a semenay a emave’av(ljemanguy).
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: aljak aken nua Paiwan zuku.
I am an Paiwan child.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我是排灣族的小孩。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: i Tjalja’avus a nia umaq.
Our family lives in Tjalja’avus.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們家住在來義。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: malje lima men a tace’eljan.
There are five people in our family.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們家共有五個人。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: matjelu amen a marevetjevetjek.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua ti kama/ama, ti kina/ina tiaken, katua ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay katua tjavulung a vavayan, namatevetevelj amen a tacekeljan.
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 有爸爸、媽媽和我、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qacaqaca ti kama, kisacu a ku kama.
My father is tall and he is a policeman.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: riljariljay ti kina, kuisang a ku kina.
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qivuyivu ti kama tua penaiyuanan i tjumaq tjanuamen.
My father speaks the paiwan language with us at home.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu kaljapulavayan cemikel amen a sema qinaljan.
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們暑假都會回部落。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: vaik aken katua mareka ku kaka a tjavavulungan a djemekep tua kiav.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tjengelay aken aravac tua mareka ku sikatacemekeljan.
I like our family very much.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: vaik amen ati kina a kivangavang tucu a qadav.
I went out with my mother today.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: namaljenguaq a kalevelevan nu muqadadav, inika ljemaljaqel inika zemulezul, sarenguaq ca vali.
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: kemakan amen ta minpau i cemecemel i azatjan, ipaqadav amen, semeljec aravac.
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta masukincengelj, mequdjilj a kalevelevan.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 下午，天空變紅了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ku kivadaqan ti kina, akuazua mequdjilj cu a kalevelevan?
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的?

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qivu ti kina, panema ta uri uzazanga a vali aya.
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu qazemezemetj neka zua kelebav i kalevelevan, tjevuta anga a vitjuqan.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: uri tjumaq anga amen uta.
We were going home too.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們也要回家了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tjumatjumaq amen i djalan, kisaljinga aken ta vitjuqan.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: saljinga ken tua inika mangtjez a vali, pasa vaivaik anan aken a kivangavang aya ken.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: i ljaqediqedi tua nia umaq a ku gakku, djemedje aken a djemavac a sema gakku, sa ’u djavac uta a tjumaq.
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: inika tjaljiqacaqaca a nia gakku, inika tjuruvu a mareka vencik, namakakeljakeljang amen a masantalj.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: namatevetevelj amen i vava’asan, maciyuciyur amen a seman mali, sa’a matjatjauci’eci’el amen uta.
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: kisaseljang tjanuamen a nia sinsi a kivangavang uta, namaya tua tacemekeljan amen i gakku.
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ljemita tu qadav a semuasuap amen, maljiyan tua namaparimasudj aravac a nia kakituluan.
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua vaik a semisic tua qezung, izua vaik a semuap ta zaqetja.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nia suapen anan a penalinguljan a nia gakku, mapangapangalj amen tua sengsengan, namapalimasudj a ljemita tu qadav a nia gakku.
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: navaik aken a sema qinaljan a kivala tjaivuvu tatiav.
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: cuacuay anga men a inika mecevucevung, sengelit anga aken tjaimadju.
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tapacunan aken ni vuvu, pakanan aken tua suika, patekelan aken tua utja.
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qaljemaqem aravac a sinitalem ni vuvu a suika, sanguaq angata.
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tjengelay aken a temekel tua utja ni vuvu uta, sanguaq aravac.
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: vecekadan nu qadav, kemesa amen kati vuvu tua nia cengelj.
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nakemesa anga ti vuvu tua masanliyaliav a kinsa, izua ciqav, izua kuka, izua tjingkuy, izua kacikacing/dingding.
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta makakincengelj amen, vaik amen a sema puljacengan a ki ljaceng.
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: sikalap aken ni vuvu tua liav a vurati, a vasa katua niniku, kacu-u a tjumaq aya.
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 奶奶為我拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ku kipusauan tiamadju, sa kinamangtjez anan nu tjaivililj a kivala tjanumun ku ayain.
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tucu a qadav kacuin amen ni sinsi a sema tua zaziljavan tua qemuziquzip, kipacumali amen a veneli tua kipu i paljing.
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta tedep amen i puqemuziquzipan, qivu ti sinsi, “aicu a i qayav mareka qayaqayam, azua i vililj mareka qatjuvi, ziljavu a masantalj.”
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
我早上七點鐘到學校。: so you can visit them yourself.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35101/5: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: marekutj aken ta qatjuvi, manasika inika navaik a pacun tua mareka qatjuvi.
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pacun aken tua liav a qayaqayam, minlayalayap i vavav tua kasiv, izua za ljequ i taladje tua kasiv a nataqed uta.
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua za zu, unma katua likuljav i puqemuziquzipan, inika napavala pacun tuca mareka qemuziquzip, maleva aken angata tua ku pinacunan tucu a qadav.
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: napasasing aken a pakaliav, sa ku sipapacun tjai kama kati kina.
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: sa’a nu tjaivililj tjara kinakiciyur tjai kama kati kina a sema maza.
Next time I will come with my parents.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tucu a pulavay, vaik a ken katua ku kaka a tjavulung a vavayan a sema akav a kivala tjai kama i Druna.
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 這個假日，我和姊姊去屏東拜訪叔叔Druna。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: maka kisiya amen a kemasi Taihuku a sema Akav.
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們從台北搭火車去屏東。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: djemaljum amen i Akav, na unting tua haiya ti kama i Druna a kicacevung tjanuamen.
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 到了屏東，叔叔Druna開車來車站接我們。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: inika cemadja a umaq ni kama i Druna tua tisaba, inika cuway i djalan djemaljun anga.
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 車站離叔叔Druna家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua za i djemet tua umaq a tjaljiqacaqaca a quma ni kama i Druna, vaik amen a semazua a makapalidring.
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 叔叔Druna家附近有個很大的牧場田園，我們一起騎腳踏車到田園。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: i tua quma, kacuin amen ni kama i Druna a pakan tua sizi katua gung.
In the ranch, my uncle Druna took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 在田園裡，叔叔Druna帶我們餵羊和餵牛。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta masulem, kacuin amen a sema lizuk a keman tua kinsa.
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: liav aravac a pacacikecikel a sidusiya/haiya i kadjalanan, manasika maka utubai amen a sema zua.
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 市區路上汔車來往很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta uri vavaik anga men izua, manu cinekav anga nia utubay, saka nia maka basu anga sakamay.
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nacemikel anga men a sema Taihuku tucu, inika ken a kemeljang tui djinumak anga a utubay ni kama i Druna.
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔Druna的摩托車找到了沒有。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: i Akav a nia umaq ta kakedriyan anan aken, ta sema gakku anga ken, patjavat amen a sema Tauyun, saka izuazua angamen i lizuk a kikavaljut a patjetucu.
When we were young, our family lived in Donghe. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 小時候我們家住在屏東，上學以後，就搬到了桃園，一直在都市裡生活。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: makalap anga aken tua taigakku, sa ku kitulu tuazuz masanitalj a patjara nu kacalisian a kakudakudan a tulu, avanazua kemeljang aken tua napenakaizuazua a tja kakudan a kacalisian i Taiwan.
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: manasika, tucu a cavilj a pulavay tua zulezulan, vaik aken katua ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay a sema qinaljan a kivadaq tua ramaljemaljeng, pasa kikeljang amen tua nitjen a kakudakudan.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: aluangapuluq a cavilj ni vuvu, ljakua nu tja pacunan nasa’edriyan anan sakamaya.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ku kivadaqan timadju tu anemanema kinacaqu a kai, tauliq aravac a qivu tua penayuanan, macaqu a dremipungan, a dremekaiyan katua penairangan uta.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Saisiyat, as well as Atayal, Hakka and Japanese.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我問他會哪些語言，他的排灣語說得很流利，也會說日本話、魯凱語和閩南語。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta makakivadaq anga ken tjaimadju, djaljepan ta kakedrian anan timadju, na kitulu tua dremipungan, azua cekelj se drekai zuku, saka pizua tua sengsengan nimadju nasekeljang tua tjuruvu a pairang, manasika liav a kinacaqu a kai nimadju.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是鲁凱族人，而他工作上認識許多漢人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: itua nia kinaqepuan, liav aravac a sitjaucikecikel tua patjara semicuacuayan a caquan nua qemaljup.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ljai inika men a sepualalang, ljakua nia linuing a paka tua dingwa, maqati a nia umaljen anan a kiladenga.
Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta kakedrian anan aken, inika ken a nakemeljang tua tja kakudan a paiwan, nasemiaq tu kacalisian aken pai.
When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu tjaliav a ku kinljangan, tja ljemaui tu Paiwan zuku aken, napakisumalji, sedjaljep tu ku sikipasukuda uta.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Saisiyat is unique and something to be proud of.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為排灣族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tucu a masulesulem a qadav, uri tjumaq a ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: vaik aken katua ku vuvu a sema siyubai a veneli ta kuka, padjulu ta sipakaiv tua ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: cemalivat amen itua paveliveli ta ljaceng, liav aravac a za namapakaizuazua a nasasanguaq a ljaceng.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: naveneli amen tua kabula, qaqilj katua taicav.
We bought chinese cabbage, yams and carrots.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們買了白菜、山藥和蘿蔔。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: maitucu aza paveliveli ta kudamunu a tauki, “qaljemaqem aravac ca u pangudralj katua kutjis. pay veliyu tu kedri!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: saka nia veli anga ta pangudralj katua kutjis.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: cemalivat amen tua puvutjuljan, qivu a tauki, “anema nu veliin? pacuni cu a u kuka kakudralan saka sasanguaq aravac, nu ita tjeluaiday a avelian.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?請看我賣的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pazangal cu aya ti vuvu, saka kivadaq ta tauki tui maqati a papemadjuluin.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ljakua qivu a tauki, madjulu anga cu, inika maqati anga tja kiluvadan aya.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: maitucu aza kiljaqediqedi a tauki a qivu, idu veliyu ta ku ciqav, kakudralan sa mamadjuluan.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta vililjanga naveneli anga men ta kuka ta ciqaw, saka nia vaik anga a tjumaq a kemesa tua tahandayan a djamay.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: cuai amen a kiljaljavaljav, masulem anga.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: manu pakadinguwa a ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay, inika maqati anga a pulavai aya i pusivitayan, uri pinutjaivililj anga ku sisatjumaqan aya.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na kemesa anga itjen a pakaliav aya ti vuvu, pai tja kanavanga sakamaya a masantalj!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nia djauljen anga sakamaya a nia kaka katua nia qali, saka nia atevetevelj a kaiv.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua za ku salasaladj a ti Uljelje, ru draudrav a kemacu tua nemanga nimadju.
I have a classmate named Uljelje, he often forgets to bring things.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我有一個同學叫Uljelje，他常常忘記帶東西。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu kitulutulu amen, kisedjam timadju tua salasaladj ta inpic, siquliqulip katua vaveikan a laqulj/zakitju.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: puita, pudrusa, putjelu, nia pasedjam sakamaya timadja.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ljakua, izua za nakuyakuya a sikudakudan nimadju, inika ru pacikel tua kinisedjam a nemanga.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta vililjanga, nekanga nu salasaladj a pasapasedjam tjaimadju.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua tu ita qadav, vaik amen a maciyuciyur a kivangavang.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta i djalan amen, manu malingav ti Uljelje, ljakua inika napaqenetj a kemacu tua siidjuadjuas.
On the way, Uljelje wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 路途中，Uljelje想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: saka patjanemain a salasaladj tua sikidjuadjuas, tevelain a mayatucu, inika men a nakemacu uta ayain.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qemaung anga ti Uljelje tua uwalan. madudu a qivu, awa inika mun a pasedjam tjanuaken tua sikidjuadjuas aya!
Uljelje burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我早上七點鐘到學校。: Uljelje急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qaqivuin nua salasaladj a mayatucu, ayatua inika sun a nakemacu, saka nu tja pasedjaman sun ta nemanga, inika sun a pacikecikel uta!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta maljiya, namedjama anga ti Uljelje i gakku, saka pacikeli a kinisedjam a nemanga tua mareka salasaladj a penuljat.
The next day at school, Uljelje arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 隔天上學，Uljelje很早就到學校了，Uljelje把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pudjavadjavai tua mareka salasaladj ti Uljelje, saka qivu a mayatucu, kiken a kemacu anga tua ku nemanga nutjaivililj, saka pumaljimalji tua mareka salasaladj tua pinasedjaman tjaimadju a pasusangas anga a qadav.
Uljelje  apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: Uljelje向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: cinunan a ’u ama i qinaljan.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta kakedriyan anan aken, nu qazemezemetj vaik a casav ti kama kati kama i Kapi, nakemacu tua tjakit katua kuang.
When I was little, my dad and uncle Kapi would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔Kapi會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu maljia, nakemacu anga tua qinaljup a sacemal tiamadju.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nucuayanga vavui, nucuayanga lava, panema tua padjavatan uta.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pangapangaljen a sacemel i sipangetjez i qinaljan niamadju, sa’a qaluti a sikataqaljan.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ku culaqen ti kama, vaik aken a keciyur tjanusun a qemaljup ku ayain.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ulja sun a meqaca anan, ku kacuav anga ayain aken ni kama/ama.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pudringai a mareka uqaljaqaljay i qinaljan tua sacemel uta, macaqu tiamadj a semanaya tua seluc katua caqeljip/qezetj.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: macaqu aravac ti ama a seman seluc, sidringadringay cu tua padjavatan aya ti ama, nia puqezeljan a djukap na sacemel, sa nia pudringai a pinakazuazuanan a djaladjalan.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: aza saljinga ken a kiciyur ta ramaljeng a qemalju, djemedje aken a kicaquan tua seman dringay, manu inika cuacuay dremingai a paruarut a ku sinanaya a dringan tua sacemel.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pacun ti ama tua ku sipudringayan, qivu a mayatucu, maljiyan tua uri lemanav sun a cinunan aya.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tucu a meqaca anga ken, ku sevaljen a ku vetjeljatan katua panaq, sa’a vaik a kiciyur tjai ama a qemaljup.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: cemikel amen a sema qinaljan, nia siqalut a nia inalap a sacemel tua nia sikataqaljan.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qivu ti ama, maleva itjen tua papuluqem nua tja vuvu, pinapusepiyan itjen tucu a qadav.
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na sekavililj aken a sema gakku ta kadjaman.
I was late for school this morning.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: inika na kemacu aken tua kabang, ta vaik aken a sema gakku.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: neka nu ku kinacu a nanemaneman.
I didn’t bring anything with me.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu kitulutulu amen, pacun amen a meseljang ta laqulj katua ku salasaladj.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nu siking amen, pasedjaman aken ta inpic katua siquliqulip na ku salasaladj.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qivu ti sinsi tjanuaken a mayatucu, “djamau anga paceged nu tjaivililj mayanga sekavililj!”
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ti Puljaljuyan a ku qali, aljak nua paiwan zuku auta timadju.
My good friend’s name is Puljaljuyan, and he is also an Paiwan child.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我的好朋友叫 Puljaljuyan，他也是排灣族的小孩。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: kitulutulu amen i Tjaljakavus a mamav.
We study together in the Tjaljakavus tribe.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們一起在來義部落讀書。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ru vaik amen a kilangeda ta ramaljemaljeng a menilimilingan, macaqu amen aravac a penaiwanan.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Paiwan proficiently.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說排灣語。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qacaqaca sa kudrakudral aken, kedrikedri sa kuljakuljay ti Puljaljuyan.
I am tall and overweight, while Puljaljuyan is short and thin.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Puljaljuyan很矮也很瘦。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na rucikal aravac ti Puljaljuyan,kinatjengelayan timadju nua timaimanga.
Puljaljuyan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: Puljaljuyan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: undukay tucu a qadav nua gakku,liyav a malalumalj a pinadjulu nua gakku.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: izua maqaqesir, djemakadjak ta mali, mekelj, iyuki katua penanaq.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ilalumaljan aken tua mekelj.
I participated in the running competition.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta mekekelj a ken, sequlilj aken, pedjamuq tu qaca a ku cungal.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ljakua migacalj aken sa na mekelj sakamaya a patjaiqayav.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: maleva tjuruvu a caucau ta tjeljavang aken sa djaljun tua qaqacuvungan.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ini na sangasangasan ljakua namaleva ken aravac ayatua naqemacuvung aken tua malalumalj.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na vaik amen tatiav kati kama a paljilji tjai kama i Kapi.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪kapi叔叔。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nasekakuda a kula ni kama i kapi.
My uncle injured his foot.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: Kapi叔叔的腳受傷了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: namaperunganga a qinaljivan aya timadju a pasemalav tjanuamen.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na matjani timadju a kemasi qaljiv ta seman nanguanguaq tua qaljiv.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na kemacu ti kama ta vutjulj na kung katua saviki tu sipavay tja kama i Kapi.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給Kapi叔叔。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: liav a siniqivu ni kama i Kapi a milimilingan ta maljavaljavar amen i qarengan.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nameqaca sa namesauqaljayanga sun aya ti kama i Kapi a semanzua tjanuaken ta uri vaik anga ken.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pangtjezuanga kivala a sema tjanuamen nu navenalanga su kula ku ayain ti kama i Kapi.
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta 2022 a cavilj napakaigi a sihu ta maqatianga sepapuvecik a tja ngadan a kinacalisian a pitua tja mibunsiu.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: nakisusu aken tua kisamuljamulja a kiqaunga tua sihu ta sepapuvecik a tja ngadan a kinacalisian a pitua tja mibunsiu a tja maqacuvucuvung i qinaljan a ti Puljaljuan.
I interviewed Puljaljuyan, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Puljaljuyan。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na mare kicun anga men ta nu tucu a pulavalavay vaik amen a sema ta umaq nimadju a maljavaljavar
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta maljavaljavar amen pasemalavan aken ta kinasizuanan nua ngadan nimadju, sa na pakeljangi tua sikatacemekeljan nimadju katua qinaljan nimadju.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他告訴我他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ku kivadaqan timadju tu anema sikipatjemacay ta pavalit tua ngadan,a inika nanguaq a kakudan a sikipuvecikan a pasusangas?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qivu timadju tjanuaken a mayatucu, “ayatua a tjiniukukuan inika maqati a mapasalusu a siqivuan tua ngadan nimadju, tjuruvu a caucau a ti Pu sinseng aya tjaimadju, sa napenepedjeli aravac.”
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Pu Xian Sheng
我早上七點鐘到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35101/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「Pu先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: qivu ti Puljaljuyan, “a tja ngadan a vincikan tua tjavecik avanazua tja kangadanan,a ku ngadan sinipupatarevan ta ku qinaljan ku kinacemekeljan ta ku nasi,ulja napatja tjuruvu a caucau a pacikel tua tjaratja ngadangadan.”
Puljaljuyan said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我早上七點鐘到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35101/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Puljaljuyan說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: na vaik amen a semiyubay ta tiav a ti vuvu i vavayan,liav a kinacu ni vuvu a sinitalem nimadju a ljaceng,sa na seman kakanen ta nu kacalisian auta a sipavay ta timaimanga.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: tjuruvu a tjengelay ta siyubay ni vuvu i vavayan, tjuruvu a veneli ta silji katua vurati, tjuruvu auta a qemayam tua sinandjamay nimadju.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and sweet potato, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和地瓜很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: maljiyan tu sanguaq a kinesa nimadju a lukuc katua djuadjuya a paday, izua nan a cinapan a vutjulj na vavuy, tjuruvu a namadjaulja ta saluman, sa nacumali, a timaimanga izua ta nia siubay.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉烤的肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: ta kemesakesa ti vuvu i vavayan, izua ken a tjemautjautjav i ljaqediqedi a idu veliu ta nia sinitalem a tiamen a ljaceng, inika pinabusbusan ta cemel.
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, “The vegetables are self-grown, all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: veliyen a pakirimurimu a nia nemanga,qivu ti vuvu a mayatucu ayatua izua sun a napusaladj a paveli aya,
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: pakasimaza, kituluanga ken ta caquan na patjara tataleman katua kakanen na kacalisian, sa nakemeljang auta ta zelian na semiyubaubay.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

pitju a zikangan a ku sisagakkuan nu kad: maljiyan tu maleva tu mapumudingan a ken ta pacun aken tua tjenglayan ni vuvu i vavayan ta tja kakanen na sekacalisian.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我早上七點鐘到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
